articles.headline: Strike Prevents Actors From Promoting Films at Premieres or Festivals
articles.snippet: While on strike, actors are barred from publicizing any studio projects they’ve appeared in. Their absence could affect movie theaters and the festival circuit.
articles.abstract: While on strike, actors are barred from publicizing any studio projects they’ve appeared in. Their absence could affect movie theaters and the festival circuit.
articles.lead_paragraph: It has already been a difficult year for movie theaters, with the North American box office down roughly 20 percent from last year. And that was when actors could promote their films.

articles.headline: Vulnerable Republicans Take a Political Risk With Abortion Vote
articles.snippet: In uniting his party behind a defense bill loaded with social policy restrictions, Speaker Kevin McCarthy has raised questions over whether his short-term victory could imperil his majority.
articles.abstract: In uniting his party behind a defense bill loaded with social policy restrictions, Speaker Kevin McCarthy has raised questions over whether his short-term victory could imperil his majority.
articles.lead_paragraph: Representative Jen Kiggans, a minivan-driving mom and Navy veteran, narrowly won election last year in her suburban Virginia swing district after a fiercely competitive race that focused on her opposition to abortion rights.

articles.headline: Without Hollywood, What Happens to Los Angeles?
articles.snippet: With actors and screenwriters on strike, Hollywood is shut down for the foreseeable future. Los Angeles isn’t a pure company town, but the industry is inextricable from the city in many ways.
articles.abstract: With actors and screenwriters on strike, Hollywood is shut down for the foreseeable future. Los Angeles isn’t a pure company town, but the industry is inextricable from the city in many ways.
articles.lead_paragraph: Los Angeles County has 88 cities. Ten million people. Two hundred-plus languages spoken.

articles.headline: Can A.I. Invent?
articles.snippet: A group of legal experts are pressing patent agencies, courts and policymakers to address the question as generative A.I. seems on the brink of invading another uniquely human endeavor.
articles.abstract: A group of legal experts are pressing patent agencies, courts and policymakers to address the question as generative A.I. seems on the brink of invading another uniquely human endeavor.
articles.lead_paragraph: Generative artificial intelligence, the technology engine powering the popular ChatGPT chatbot, seems to have a limitless bag of tricks. It can produce on command everything from recipes and vacation plans to computer code and molecules for new drugs.

articles.headline: Canadian Politicians Who Criticize China Become Its Targets
articles.snippet: As China increases its reach in diaspora communities, Chinese Canadian politicians in Vancouver are the focus of Chinese state interference in Canadian politics.
articles.abstract: As China increases its reach in diaspora communities, Chinese Canadian politicians in Vancouver are the focus of Chinese state interference in Canadian politics.
articles.lead_paragraph: The polls predicted a re-election victory, maybe even a landslide.

articles.headline: ‘Not for Machines to Harvest’: Data Revolts Break Out Against A.I.
articles.snippet: Fed up with A.I. companies consuming online content without consent, fan fiction writers, actors, social media companies and news organizations are among those rebelling.
articles.abstract: Fed up with A.I. companies consuming online content without consent, fan fiction writers, actors, social media companies and news organizations are among those rebelling.
articles.lead_paragraph: For more than 20 years, Kit Loffstadt has written fan fiction exploring alternate universes for “Star Wars” heroes and “Buffy the Vampire Slayer” villains, sharing her stories free online.
articles.byline: By Sheera Frenkel and Stuart A. Thompson

articles.headline: In the Land of Football, a Cricket Oasis Rises Outside Houston
articles.snippet: The game of cricket has taken hold in Texas’ largest city, as a culture of sports competition meets a growing South Asian population.
articles.abstract: The game of cricket has taken hold in Texas’ largest city, as a culture of sports competition meets a growing South Asian population.
articles.lead_paragraph: Drive northwest out of Houston, and as cow pastures wrestle back the flat expanse from the city’s tentacled sprawl, there arise along the road, suddenly, improbably, many, many cricket fields.
articles.byline: By J. David Goodman and Meridith Kohut

articles.headline: Turmoil in Florida’s New State Guard, as Some Recruits Quit
articles.snippet: Some who volunteered for the force commissioned by Gov. Ron DeSantis said the group, billed as a natural disaster relief organization, had become too militarized.
articles.abstract: Some who volunteered for the force commissioned by Gov. Ron DeSantis said the group, billed as a natural disaster relief organization, had become too militarized.
articles.lead_paragraph: Early last summer, complaining that Washington had failed to provide adequate staffing for Florida’s National Guard, Gov. Ron DeSantis announced that for the first time in 75 years he was activating the State Guard, a force of volunteers that could respond to hurricanes and other public emergencies.

articles.headline: A National Treasure, Tarnished: Can Britain Fix Its Health Service?
articles.snippet: As it turns 75, the N.H.S., a proud symbol of Britain’s welfare state, is in the deepest crisis of its history.
articles.abstract: As it turns 75, the N.H.S., a proud symbol of Britain’s welfare state, is in the deepest crisis of its history.
articles.lead_paragraph: Fifteen hours after she was taken out of an ambulance at Queen’s Hospital with chest pains and pneumonia, Marian Patten was still in the emergency room, waiting for a bed in a ward. Mrs. Patten, 78, was luckier than others who arrived at this teeming hospital, east of London: She had not yet been wheeled into a hallway.

articles.headline: Small, Hidden and Deadly: Mines Stymie Ukraine’s Counteroffensive
articles.snippet: To gain ground, Ukrainian forces have to make their way through a variety and density of Russian land mines they never imagined.
articles.abstract: To gain ground, Ukrainian forces have to make their way through a variety and density of Russian land mines they never imagined.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was a grisly scene of bloody limbs and crumpled vehicles as a series of Russian mines exploded across a field in southern Ukraine.

articles.headline: A New Job for Electric Vehicles: Powering Homes During Blackouts
articles.snippet: Some energy experts say battery-powered vehicles will increasingly help keep the lights on and support electric grids, rather than straining them.
articles.abstract: Some energy experts say battery-powered vehicles will increasingly help keep the lights on and support electric grids, rather than straining them.
articles.lead_paragraph: In early March, strong winds brought down trees and power lines in the Nashville area, leaving thousands of homes without power. But about 20 miles outside the city an electric pickup truck fed energy to John and Rachelle Reigard’s home, keeping their lights on.

articles.headline: Labor Day Looms as Crisis Point in Hollywood Stalemate
articles.snippet: Ongoing strikes could disrupt the entertainment industry in fundamental ways, putting the 2024 box office and the fall broadcast lineup in jeopardy.
articles.abstract: Ongoing strikes could disrupt the entertainment industry in fundamental ways, putting the 2024 box office and the fall broadcast lineup in jeopardy.
articles.lead_paragraph: In May, when 11,500 movie and television writers went on strike, Hollywood companies like Netflix, NBCUniversal and Disney reacted with what amounted to a shrug. The walkout wasn’t great, but executives had expected it for months. They could ride it out.
articles.byline: By Benjamin Mullin, Brooks Barnes and Nicole Sperling

articles.headline: Trump and Allies Forge Plans to Increase Presidential Power in 2025
articles.snippet: The former president and his backers aim to strengthen the power of the White House and limit the independence of federal agencies.
articles.abstract: The former president and his backers aim to strengthen the power of the White House and limit the independence of federal agencies.
articles.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump and his allies are planning a sweeping expansion of presidential power over the machinery of government if voters return him to the White House in 2025, reshaping the structure of the executive branch to concentrate far greater authority directly in his hands.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Swan, Charlie Savage and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Riots in France Highlight a Vicious Cycle Between Police and Minorities
articles.snippet: Calls to overhaul the police go back decades. But violent episodes of police enforcement continue. So do violent outpourings on the street.
articles.abstract: Calls to overhaul the police go back decades. But violent episodes of police enforcement continue. So do violent outpourings on the street.
articles.lead_paragraph: Years before France was inflamed with anger at the police killing of a teenager during a traffic stop, there was the notorious Théo Luhaka case.
articles.byline: By Catherine Porter and Constant Méheut

articles.headline: One Reason China Is Willing to Engage Again: Its Troubled Economy
articles.snippet: China was on track to recover after closing itself off during the pandemic. Now the country’s growth is staggering, and Beijing is signaling it is open to talking.
articles.abstract: China was on track to recover after closing itself off during the pandemic. Now the country’s growth is staggering, and Beijing is signaling it is open to talking.
articles.lead_paragraph: Three months ago it appeared that China’s economy was on track to recover relatively quickly after being closed off to the world during the pandemic. Consumers were spending again. Exports picked up. Even China’s beleaguered housing market gave hints it was stabilizing.

articles.headline: Electric Vehicle Prices Fall as Automakers Raise Production
articles.snippet: Ford, Tesla and other automakers are having to lower prices to lure buyers as the supply of battery-powered models begins to exceed demand.
articles.abstract: Ford, Tesla and other automakers are having to lower prices to lure buyers as the supply of battery-powered models begins to exceed demand.
articles.lead_paragraph: After struggling to find enough batteries and other parts for the past couple of years, automakers are finally beginning to churn out large numbers of electric cars and trucks. More than 30 new models will arrive in showrooms this year.
